DOC.brief_title: Smart-phone Application Promote Medication Adherence Adolescents Young Adults ( AYA ) With Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: Non-adherence oral medication prevalent problem adolescent young adult ( AYA ) cancer may impact survival quality life treatment . The purpose study explore use smart-phone medication reminder application promote adherence oral medication AYA cancer . The study 's primary aim explore feasibility acceptability use smart-phone medication reminder application promote adherence oral medication AYA cancer well characterize application use . Secondary aim include : 1 ) obtain initial estimate intervention effect- measured pre-intervention post-intervention difference perceive behavioral control adherence , intention adhere , adherence behavior - inform design future trial power detect clinically significant effect smart-phone medication reminder application use adherence oral medication ; 2 ) examine relationship among perceived behavioral control adherence , intention adhere , adherence behavior . A pre-post single group design use . Data collect weekly 4 week introduction intervention 8 week follow introduction intervention . Analytic approach include descriptive statistic generalize estimate equation ( GEE ) modeling .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : 1 ) 1529 year old receive treatment type cancer , either primary recurrent/relapsed disease . 2 ) Patient complete least one month therapy 3 ) Patient expect remain therapy 3 month duration study 4 ) Patient iPhone , iPad , iTouch run iOS 4.0 later 5 ) Patient willing use smartphone medication reminder application 1 ) Patients unable speak/read/write English require use smartphone medication reminder application completion study measure .
